QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Laser therapy
QAPair.Answer: The laser light beam does not pose health risks to the person or medical team. Laser treatment has some of the same risks as open surgery, including pain, bleeding, and scarring. But recovery time from laser surgery is usually faster than recovery from open surgery. Lasers can be used for many medical purposes. Because the laser beam is so small and precise, it allows health care providers to safely treat tissue without injuring the surrounding area. Lasers are often used to: Treat varicose veins , Improve vision during eye surgery on the cornea , Repair a detached retina of the eye , Remove parts of the prostate , Remove kidney stones , Remove tumors , Lasers are also often used during skin surgery .
